summary: This is further to a discussion I had earlier today concerning whether Daenerys is likely to go ‘mad’ like her father.  In the...
caption:
This is further to a discussion I had earlier today concerning whether Daenerys is likely to go ‘mad’ like her father. 

In the original script for Stormborn, she was constantly being identified as “the Mad Kings Daughter”. According to Brian Cogman, the script was originally titled “The Mad Kings Daughter”, although many of the references in the script did not make it to the end product. Daenerys herself doesn’t appear to be showing any signs of being delusional or any sign of being insane as such, but it would be foolish to ignore the fact that she is deliberately following in her father’s footsteps, even while protesting she is “not [her] father”.

She makes a conscious decision to embrace her family’s legacy of “Fire and Blood”, and this includes the ruthless suppression of dissent through dragon fire. It is a dream of absolute power which brooks no opposition.

Although you could argue that a person who shows a preference for killing people by burning them alive may not be living their best self, she clearly does this with a rational desire to intimidate her enemies. Her emotionless response to watching people die is disturbing and could point to sociopathic tendencies, but in Westerosii society is unlikely to be labelled as ‘mad’. Many both in-universe and out would view this as strength.

Something that is made clear all the way back in Season 1 by Maester Pycelle, is that her father did not start out as mad. He says he was a ‘charmer’ who was slowly ‘consumed by dreams of fire and blood’. In the books, we learn that his slide into madness began as paranoia, probably aided by the machinations of his Lannister Hand. But that is beyond the scope of this meta.

There is a deep pathos to the way Pycelle talks of Aerys.  This scene, often dismissed as the ravings of an unlikeable fool, foreshadows Daenerys’ slide, if not into madness, at least into villainy. It is our warning, too easily dismissed.

There were two incidents included in Season 7 that seem to be pointing to a growing paranoia. In the books Daenerys is constantly looking for betrayal, always wondering of what the ‘three treasons’ might consist. In the show, there is little to point to this internal turmoil. The treasons prophecy itself never made it into the show. 

We have the deleted scene from Season 4 between her and Missendei, and it is a shame it wasn’t included. It would have made the two Season 7 scenes appear to come less out of the blue. 

In the beach scene, Daenerys startles her advisors with her sudden accusations against Tyrion. Look at her expression. Eyes wide, almost popping out of her head with anger. Missendei is even shown cowering behind Varys. Jon is looking around with a ‘good grief, is this normal’ expression.

The next scene is another one where she turns on Tyrion, this time with little justification. The suggestion she should plan for the future is not unreasonable, but it sends her into another paranoid rant.

Both scenes show how easy it is for her to lose her temper (”when have I lost my temper”) and, in the second scene, with such little provocation. One wonders how she would react to proof of real betrayal, or at least a more solid suspicion of it. We don’t really need to wonder because she straight up tells Varys. “If you ever betray me, I’ll burn you alive”. 

None of these scenes shows a level of paranoia that could be viewed as anywhere near approaching ‘madness’. It does, however, show how easily Daenerys can be led by her feelings of paranoia to lash out in ways that could be truly catastrophic. She does have dragons after all.

blog.name: artofthrones
blog.title: The Art of Ice and Fire
blog.description:
Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire Art Blog, None of these are original works.  If you re-blog from here, keep the artist's credits within your re-blog! Background and Avatar by the excellent Prokrik.

Spoilers in some pictures! Be wary, I'm not responsible for your discoveries!

Use the home link, or the orange top right X to navigate back home. 

Use the search or the image tags to find your favorite houses/characters. "HLS4" for histories and lore of season 4.

summary: Woman? Is that meant to insult me? I would return the slap, if I took you for a man.
body:
Woman? Is that meant to insult me? I would return the slap, if I took you for a man.

Daenerys Targaryen, ASOIAF


Still my all time favourite Dany moment if not one of the best quotes in GOT.

summary: Secrets and Sketchy Hearts - Daenerys x Sansa AU | Nox on Patreon
title: Secrets and Sketchy Hearts - Daenerys x Sansa AU | Nox on Patreon
excerpt: Join Nox on Patreon to get access to this post and more benefits.
description:
Mrs. Daenerys Stark is etched in the center of the heart. As Mr. Pycell clears her throat she looks up to see him moving on to the next slide of the lecture. She scrambles to jot down the words on the powerpoint before she goes back to outlining her heart. She feels a nudge at her shoulder from her lab partner.

“So which Stark brother?” Her lab partner whispers to her.

Read Secrets and Sketchy Hearts a week early on Patreon for only $1 a month. (based on a prompt)

summary: My mother died giving me birth, and my father and my brother Rhaegar even before that. I would never have known so much as their...
caption: My mother died giving me birth, and my father and my brother Rhaegar even before that. I would never have known so much as their names if Viserys had not been there to tell me. He was the only one left. The only one. He is all I have.

reblog.comment: My mother died giving me birth, and my father and my brother Rhaegar even before that. I would never have known so much as their names if Viserys had not been there to tell me. He was the only one left. The only one. He is all I have.

trail.content_raw: My mother died giving me birth, and my father and my brother Rhaegar even before that. I would never have known so much as their names if Viserys had not been there to tell me. He was the only one left. The only one. He is all I have.

summary:
D&D absolutely informed us who is love of his life.
And Cersei knows it. She finds it out immediately. 
It was absolutely clear...
body:
D&D absolutely informed us who is love of his life.

And Cersei knows it. She finds it out immediately.

It was absolutely clear that Jon looked Dany as pet

D&D absolutely gave us information that Cersei know who is important person in this moment. Jon looked Dany as pet and Cersei found it immediately. And why she mentioned it with Tyrion? She already has a plan. She wants to send GC to take her as prissioner and play with Jon

Cersei is absolutely smart woman

blog.name: fcparagon
blog.title: Jonerys Rulez
blog.description: Didn't know Jonerys would consume my soul

summary: i agree with you that ygritte in the show was not as bad as drogo. she was annoying to me, but i do think that she loved jon....
question: i agree with you that ygritte in the show was not as bad as drogo. she was annoying to me, but i do think that she loved jon. however I didn‘t like that relationship at all. she would have never accepeted the real jon. the one we have now, who fights for what is right and is true to his words. i think that at the end of the day she also tried to change him into something he wasn‘t and that she really didn‘t care about anything else except her and jon.
answer: Well, I do think she would accept Jon the way he is, all noble and good. But what would happen is that both would constantly be in conflict, since their opinions differ from one another. It’s one of the reasons Jon and Dany match. Their ideas, their sense of morality, matches with one another. Ygritte was trying to change him into being a Wildling, and that is where the line draws really. She wanted him to be loyal to only her, which wasn’t acceptable to Jon since he was also loyal to the NW. Regardless of that, I can’t blame her for wanting nothing else but her and Jon. She’s strong, but she comes from simple life, and she’s met this handsome man who makes her happy. In a way it is selfish, but considering the number of struggles Wildlings go through, I don’t blame her for having this dream.

She’s strong, but she comes from simple life, and she’s met this handsome man who makes her happy. In a way it is selfish, but considering the number of struggles Wildlings go through, I don’t blame her for having this dream.

tags: one of the prettiest scenes in the show
summary: It was a sea, Dany thought. Past here, there were no hills, no mountains, no trees nor cities nor roads, only the endless...
caption: It was a sea, Dany thought. Past here, there were no hills, no mountains, no trees nor cities nor roads, only the endless grasses, the tall blades rippling like waves when the winds blew. “It’s so green,” she said.

reblog.comment: It was a sea, Dany thought. Past here, there were no hills, no mountains, no trees nor cities nor roads, only the endless grasses, the tall blades rippling like waves when the winds blew. “It’s so green,” she said.

trail.content_raw: It was a sea, Dany thought. Past here, there were no hills, no mountains, no trees nor cities nor roads, only the endless grasses, the tall blades rippling like waves when the winds blew. “It’s so green,” she said.
trail.content: It was a sea, Dany thought. Past here, there were no hills, no mountains, no trees nor cities nor roads, only the endless grasses, the tall blades rippling like waves when the winds blew. “It’s so green,” she said.

body:
The Dany hate is strong.

The hate for Dany is so strong in certain parts of the Fandom that I think some would even go for the idea of the NK teaming up with the Starks to end her. The Lannisters have been trying to wipe out the Stark’s and in some instances have been successful and people are really hoping that Cersei can team up with the Stark’s to take out Dany😲 It’s like,to hell with Ned,Robb,Talisa,Catelyn and by association Ricon. Dany being taken out so that she is out of the way of a certain crackship is more important than dealing with the family who is responsible for the almost demise of the Stark’s. I don’t even know why am acting surprised when these are some of the same people who are foaming at the mouth that Jamie is going to pledge his sword to the Redhead in the North,the same man who is responsible for Bran almost dying and being a cripple,killing Jory and almost killing Ned. But I guess as long as Jon gets to bang the Redhead all is well with some. I love Dany and by no means do I think she is perfect but when you have people wanting her demise instead of Jamie and Cersei who have fucked over the Stark’s(which these people claim to love)something is seriously wrong somewhere.

body:
‪Screen time is shorter that HBO promised us last time. And

Jonsa fans thinks again that :

new Love Story, (Especially great)

Dance with the Dragons,

battle of the Dany/Jon and NK ,

Dark Dany

Political Jon

Stark and Lannister allies,

Kidnaped Plot

3 war episode is coming?

blog.name: itsgameofthronesimagines
blog.title: Valar Morghulis
blog.description:
Welcome to my Game of Thrones Imagines blog! Here: ships, requests, and fun are all welcome here! One-shots, drabbles, imagines, fake instagram, incorrect quotes, theories, debates, ships, smut are also allowed! Send writing prompt and ship requests! Boy, Girl, etc. Imagines. All sexual orientation and personal likes are welcomed here! Enjoy! (Requests: OPEN!)
Prompts: http://writingexercises.co.uk/dialogue-generator.php
